intro: Psychotria leptocarpa, commonly known as the slenderleaf psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Central and South America, particularly found in tropical regions of countries like Brazil and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale green flowers. It thrives in shaded, moist environments, often in the understory of tropical forests. The plant contains various alkaloids, which have been of interest in ethnobotanical and pharmacological studies.
